required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on November 19, 2021
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Evaluation of Daclatasvir (DCV) in Combination With Sofosbuvir (SOF) in Children With Chronic Hepatitis C (CHC) Infection
clinical_study.official_title: Open-Label, Single-Arm Trial to Evaluate the Pharmacokinetics, Safety and Efficacy of Daclatasvir (DCV) in Combination With Sofosbuvir (SOF) in Children From 3 to Less Than 18 Years of Age With GT-1 to -6 Chronic Hepatitis C (CHC) Infection

brief_summary.textblock: The purpose of this study is to evaluate daclatasvir in combination with sofosbuvir given to children with chronic hepatitis C infection

primary_outcome.measure: Minimum (Trough) Observed Plasma Concentration (Cmin) for Daclatasvir
primary_outcome.time_frame: Day 10 after first dose, collection timepoints at pre-dose, 30 min, 1 hour, 2 hours, 4 hours, and 8 hours post-dose

primary_outcome.measure: Maximum Observed Plasma Concentration (Cmax) for Daclatasvir
primary_outcome.time_frame: Day 10 after first dose, collection timepoints at pre-dose, 30 min, 1 hour, 2 hours, 4 hours, and 8 hours post-dose

primary_outcome.measure: Time of Maximum Observed Plasma Concentration (Tmax) for Daclatasvir
primary_outcome.time_frame: Day 10 after first dose, collection timepoints at pre-dose, 30 min, 1 hour, 2 hours, 4 hours, and 8 hours post-dose

primary_outcome.measure: Area Under the Concentration-Time Curve (AUC(TAU)) for Daclatasvir
primary_outcome.time_frame: Day 10 after first dose, collection timepoints at pre-dose, 30 min, 1 hour, 2 hours, 4 hours, and 8 hours post-dose

primary_outcome.measure: Apparent Total Body Clearance (CLT/F) for Daclatasvir
primary_outcome.time_frame: Day 10 after first dose, collection timepoints at pre-dose, 30 min, 1 hour, 2 hours, 4 hours, and 8 hours post-dose

secondary_outcome.measure: Number of Participants Experiencing Adverse Events
secondary_outcome.time_frame: From first dose to last dose (12 weeks)
secondary_outcome.description: This outcome describes the number of participants experiencing different types of any grade adverse events.

secondary_outcome.measure: Number of Participants Experiencing Laboratory Abnormalities - On-treatment Analysis
secondary_outcome.time_frame: From the day after first dose to last dose (approximately 12 weeks)
secondary_outcome.description: Laboratory tests abnormalities were analyzed in the following categories: Hematology (hemoglobin, platelets, international normalized ratio (INR), white blood cell count (WBC), lymphocytes (absolute), neutrophils + bands (absolute; ANC)). Hepatobiliary enzymes (ALT, AST, alkaline phosphatase, total bilirubin, albumin). Pancreatic enzymes (lipase, creatinine). Tests results were reported by worst toxicity grade (0 to 4) based on the Division of AIDS (DAIDS) Table for Grading the Severity of Adult and Pediatric Adverse Events (2017). Only laboratory abnormalities with a worst toxicity grade 3 or higher in any of the above-mentioned tests, experienced during the on-treatment period, are reported here.

secondary_outcome.measure: Number of Participants Experiencing Laboratory Abnormalities - Follow-up Analysis
secondary_outcome.time_frame: From day after last dose to end of follow-up period (up to approximately 96 weeks)
secondary_outcome.description: Laboratory tests abnormalities were analyzed in the following categories: Hematology (hemoglobin, platelets, international normalized ratio (INR), white blood cell count (WBC), lymphocytes (absolute), neutrophils + bands (absolute; ANC)). Hepatobiliary enzymes (ALT, AST, alkaline phosphatase, total bilirubin, albumin). Pancreatic enzymes (lipase, creatinine). Tests results were reported by worst toxicity grade (0 to 4) based on the Division of AIDS (DAIDS) Table for Grading the Severity of Adult and Pediatric Adverse Events (2017). Only laboratory abnormalities with a worst toxicity grade 3 or higher in any of the above-mentioned tests, experienced during the follow-up period, are reported here.

secondary_outcome.measure: Percentage of Participants With Hepatitis C Virus (HCV) RNA Levels Below the Lower Limit of Quantitation (LLOQ) at Post-Treatment Follow-Up Week 12
secondary_outcome.description: HCV RNA levels were measured by using the Roche COBAS® AmpliPrep/COBAS® TaqMan® HCV Test v2.0. This assay has a lower limit of quantitation (LLOQ) = 15 IU/mL. The outcome includes both results where Target was Detected (TD) but below LLOQ and results were Target was Not Detected (TND)

arm_group.description: Specified dose on specified days for specified duration

intervention.description: Specified dose on specified days for specified duration
Specified dose on specified days for specified duration

criteria.textblock:
For more information regarding Bristol-Myers Squibb Clinical Trial participation, please visit www.BMSStudyConnect.com
Inclusion Criteria:
- Participants monoinfected with HCV genotype -1 to -6
- HCV RNA ≥1,000 IU/mL at Screening
- Participants who are HCV-treatment naïve or treatment experienced
- Participants in Cohort 1 must have a body weight ≥ 45kg at Day 1
Exclusion Criteria:
- Mixed genotype HCV infections
- Evidence of an ongoing medical condition contributing to chronic liver disease other than HCV
- Evidence of cirrhosis, either compensated or decompensated
- Prior exposure to sofosbuvir and/or NS5A inhibitor
Other protocol defined inclusion/exclusion criteria could apply

group.description: DCV 60 mg QD + SOF 400 mg QD for 12 weeks

certain_agreements.pi_employee: Principal Investigators are NOT employed by the organization sponsoring the study.
certain_agreements.restrictive_agreement: Bristol-Myers Squibb Co. agreements with investigators vary; constant is our right to embargo communications regarding trial results prior to public release for a period ≤60 days from submittal for review. We will not prohibit investigators from publishing, but will prohibit the disclosure of previously undisclosed confidential information other than study results, and request postponement of single-center publications until after disclosure of the clinical trial's primary publication.

clinical_results.limitations_and_caveats: This study was terminated early by sponsor for reasons unrelated to safety.
